definition: night and day (idiom); continuous strenuous effort
night
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
to continue/to follow after/to go on with/to succeed/to inherit/then/afterwards
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
sun/day/date, day of the month

sentences.english: Overworking day and night left him low.
sentences.chinese: 夜以繼日地超負荷工作使他極度虛弱。

sentences.english: So he kept on working with a digital computer day and night.
sentences.chinese: 於是他夜以繼日地用一臺數字計算機工作着。

sentences.english: I have many hard-working elves putting in lots of overtime throughout the year.
sentences.chinese: 我有很多勤勞的精靈助手，他們夜以繼日地加班工作。

sentences.english: Work on the project is going on day and night.
sentences.chinese: 工程正在夜以繼日地進行。

sentences.english: E. g. : He played computer games for fun day and night in the summer vacation.
sentences.chinese: 寒假他夜以繼日地玩電腦遊戲尋覓憂子。

sentences.english: I worked day and night on my early websites, because I loved it.
sentences.chinese: 初涉網絡之時，我夜以繼日的工作，因爲我喜歡。

sentences.english: Being a farmer is a hard life. You have to work all day and all night.
sentences.chinese: 農民的生活非常不容易，因爲你必須夜以繼日地工作。

sentences.english: We have been working around the clock to try and end the violence there.
sentences.chinese: 我們正在夜以繼日地努力，試圖結束那裏的暴力。

sentences.english: Thus night and day I worked at the chain with huge fires and cruel hard strokes.
sentences.chinese: 於是，夜以繼日，烈火重錘，打造着這條鐵鏈。

sentences.english: Men of distinction ponder over good and evil day and night.
sentences.chinese: 夫貴者，夜以繼日，思慮善否。

sentences.english: Two neighbors had been fighting each other for nigh on four decades.
sentences.chinese: 兩個鄰居夜以繼日地鬥氣，鬥了有40年。

sentences.english: Day and night we are watching over your welfare.
sentences.chinese: 夜以繼日我們都在關注你們的福利。

sentences.english: They worked day and night so that they could build the bridge on time.
sentences.chinese: 他們夜以繼日地工作，爲了能按時修建起這座大橋。

definition: industrious and conscientious/assiduous
to make an effort to become strong (idiom); determined to do better/to pull one's socks up
to be up to one's ears in work (idiom)/to be unable to attend to other things at the same time
to show every possible consideration (idiom); meticulous care
part work, part study/work-study program
(jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
to admonish/instructions/orders
nursing home/hospice
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
to whisper to one another's ear
to plan/to arrange
hunger strike
to obstruct/to impede
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
impoverished/backward both economically and culturally
(to act) on one's own initiative
